content.question: The graph of velocity as a function of time shown above is for a <math alttext="10 kilogram" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>10 kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> box moving along the <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></math>-axis. Based on the graph, which of the following is a true statement?

choices.label: The linear momentum of the box is constant over the entire time frame.

The linear momentum of the box is only constant between <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="5" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></math> seconds.

The linear momentum of the box is constant between <math alttext="0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> seconds.

The maximum linear momentum of the box is <math alttext="7 kilogram meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>7</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><mtext>m/s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The minimum linear momentum of the box is <math alttext="40 kilogram meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>40</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><mtext>m/s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The linear momentum of the box is only constant between <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="5" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></math> seconds.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
